case.name: Lovely chair
case.description: Someone prepared an exquisite chair for Estelle to make her masturbation as comfortable as possible. She's the only one who gets a special treatment like that.

case.name: Messy hair
case.description: Estelle's hair gets messed up when she strips her overdress. She stays like that for 5 turns or until she enters her "lost pantyhose" stage. Other characters can unfluence the duration. It ends with a hair brushing pose and the said marker "messyend".

case.name: Estelle's Book
case.description: After Estelle finished, she will read a book about SPNatI trivia. She quotes a fact every round. All facts have an unique marker.

case.name: Book Recommendations
case.description: Estelle asks the table if they're reading anything interesting.

case.name: Staying Focused
case.description: Estelle asks the table what they do to stay on task.

case.name: A Princess's Greeting
case.description: Estelle politely greets each and every person who joins the table. If you like, you can reply using the marker EstelleGreeting.

notes.note: Disabled, but not deleted yet, because I think the extra copies of these lines can be replaced by hidden lines that just handle her messy hair, but I want to test first.

I don't think the messy hair is completely breaking, but it occurs to me that all of the lines were probably playing at the same time while they were hidden so the duration doesn't count right. So better cut it down to one case sooner rather than later.
In which we learn that Estelle does not have persistent memory, even of a very minor variety. The Inventory is a weird place!
Do I really need to spoil the whole dragon rider thing in this commonly triggered generic line? Probably not. XD

The same markers are used for each of these cases. If you want to respond the same way to both, just check for the marker EstelleFischlStart1 and not what it stores; use the value stored in the marker, or checks for what outfit Estelle is wearing, if you want to reply differently to each.

The same markers are used for each of these cases. If you want to respond the same way to both, just check for the marker EstelleFischlStart1 and not what it stores; use the value stored in the marker, or checks for what outfit Estelle is wearing, if you want to reply differently to each.

Note: as far as I'm aware, there is no canon information about the Tale of the Jade Planet, other than that the Amber Knight from that story is a good friend of the main character and Estelle's husbando. So I'm just making shit up here.

Note that Estelle has nicknamed Magma Grunt "Rubea", as per her response to Magma's Game Start line. So ~magma_grunt~ is going to expand to that in game. That sort of potential confusion is a disadvantage of my current policy of always using ids in dialogue, I guess...
Sorry for explaining the joke, but Estelle is of course talking about literal backdoors here, i.e. sneaking in through the backdoor to infiltrate a villain's hideout.

There's almost no information about the Tale of the Jade Planet in canon that I know of, other than that Estelle has read it and the Amber Knight is her husbando, so I'm making shit up here. Happy to make more shit up if Yuri wants more details, though.
Estelle doesn't immediately notice Yuri's scars, but she'll comment on them after a few rounds.
Unfortunately for me, Estelle is canonically good at coming up with names, so I hope these are good enough choices to be in character! XD
The two cases have the same marker in case you want to reply to them in the same way, but the markers store different values in case you don't.

The funny thing about this is that Estelle is one of the most effective characters in her game in terms of melee defense. XD So... I guess I'll blame magic? (Which makes sense, as she's not that durable until she gets good skills.)
Estelle is gonna kill me with her canonical proficiency at coming up with names. Hopefully these aren't too bad. XD

Almost everything Estelle says about Tale of the Jade Planet is 100% made up since there is basically no canon information on it - it's just a story Estelle likes. However I am happy to make up more shit if need be.
You can respond to this by checking that the id of your character is stored in the marker magical. Don't leave it as ~magical.id~, or it won't work!
In which we learn that Estelle does not have persistent memory, even of a very minor variety. The Inventory is a weird place!
In which we learn that Estelle does not have persistent memory, even of a very minor variety. The Inventory is a weird place!
The two cases have the same marker in case you want to reply to them in the same way, but the markers store different values in case you don't.
May revise this line depending on how Sly responds to the first one.
May revise this line depending on how Sly responds to the others.
For this and other purely reactionary targets to Sayori, I'll follow what I did with Nami and lower their priority in case I end up writing more interactive stripping targets later.
I've added values of 1/2/3 to the markers here. Shouldn't break any existing responses, but now it's easier to reply to specific lines.
I've added values of 1/2/3 to the markers here. Shouldn't break existing targets but now it's easier to reply to specific lines.

Starting with stage 1 instead of stage 0 with the expectation that the filters and Sayori's responses will usually play for stage 0.
Estelle already has some reactions to Sayori's strips, but I've lowered their priority slightly so they won't play over ordinary targeted lines; that way, any new ones don't need to match up with them, and if we don't write any new ones or the new ones don't trigger in a game, the reactions can happen instead. (I may also revise some of them in response to changes in late-game Sayori's characterization.)
Stores a different value in the marker than the other version of this case in case you want to reply differently to each.
Stores a different value in the marker than the other version of this case in case you want to reply differently to each.
Two different versions of this case using the same marker, but different stored values. You can use the different values to distinguish between them if you need to.
Two different versions of this case using the same marker, but different stored values. You can use the different values to distinguish between them if you need to.
I pulled this book and everything about it out of my ass, but mermen in Tales of Vesperia are indeed humanoid shark monsters.

Note that Estelle has nicknamed Magma Grunt "Charyb", as per her response to Magma's Game Start line in her Sharpedo costume. So ~magma_grunt~ is going to expand to that in game. That sort of potential confusion is a disadvantage of my current policy of always using ids in dialogue, I guess...
Whoops, I forgot the marker on the previous line in this sequence. Went back and added it now.

markers.marker: No longer used. I believe this was from a deleted case where the player wasn't such a gentleman removing Estelle's bra.
Estelle is told players are expected to strip all the way.
Estelle asks the table if they've read any good books lately.
Estelle talks about flying with Rita while a flying character is stripping. Oops, all Ristelle shipping!
Estelle asks the others what they do to stay focused on a task.
Estelle's first line of exposition about Yuri (Lowell).
Estelle greets another character as they enter the game.
Estelle doesn't like Leonie's idea for a mercenary title, and she's resolved to come up with something better herself!
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Flynn. Two or more times will trigger exposition lines.
Estelle reacts positively to the player helping her with her bra.
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Judith. Two or more times will trigger exposition lines.
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Karol. Two or more times will trigger exposition lines.
Estelle has learned about the forfeit.
Marker counts how long Estelle's hair should remain messy after she takes off her overdress (or equivalent item). When its value reaches 0, messyend is triggered.
Special messy-hair tracker for Perona. Estelle brushes her hair immediately when playing with Perona.
Special messy-hair tracker for Saki. Estelle brushes her hair immediately when playing with Saki.
Triggers Estelle brushing her hair so it's no longer messy. Automatically triggers in stage 4 or later.
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Patty. Not used currently, because she doesn't do it often.
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Raven. Two or more times will trigger exposition lines.
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Rita. Two or more times will trigger exposition lines.
Counts the number of times Estelle namedrops Yuri (Lowell). Two or more times will trigger exposition lines.
